text: The Lycée Louis-le-Grand () is a secondary school located in Paris. Founded in 1563 by the Jesuits as the Collège de Clermont, it was renamed in King Louis XIV of France's honor. ==References== Category:16th-century establishments in France Category:1560s establishments in Europe Category:1563 establishments Category:Colleges and universities in France Category:Schools in Paris
title: Lycée Louis-le-Grand
